blog.name: wordsintimeandspace
blog.title: I take the words. I scatter them in time and space
blog.description:
Sue, 28, from Germany. Bi/ace/nonbinary. This is mainly a Doctor Who blog (RTD era, Big Finish and Doctor/Rose), with a healthy dose of David Tennant and Billie Piper, and occasionally some stuff from other fandoms. [Pronouns: she or they]

Links:
My fanfic on tumblr and AO3 .
You can also find everything on my fanfiction masterlist. And if you still want to read more, I can recommend my fic rec lists.

Have fun!

and I always love her hashtags

blog.name: basilofbakerst
blog.title: The Mouse of 221b
blog.description: Good day to you dear sirs and madams! Call me Sigyn! The main fandoms you will find on here are Sherlock, Disney, Harry Potter, Ace Attorney, Pokemon, Marvel, and well lot's of things really. I also have a side blog here which is mostly dedicated to the Gotham Rogues and The Riddler in particular, and has all of my writing on it ^_^

summary:
Crowley cosplay (Good Omens TV series, 2019)

  Fantastic day at London MCM Comic-Con today! Met some lovely people, bought some...
caption:
Crowley cosplay (Good Omens TV series, 2019)

Fantastic day at London MCM Comic-Con today! Met some lovely people, bought some awesome trinkets and food, and to top it all off, Neil Gaiman HIMSELF replied to my tweet about my cosplay 😍! You can’t get much better than that!

tags: I guess it's fitting that this discussion (about that's what the Doctor would look like as a women)
comes about now that Jodie is the Doctor
AND now that Georgia posted the gender-swap photo of David this past weekend
(although David's 'I should be so lucky' and RTD's 'you'd never go out' are the high points for me personally)
summary:
Behind the Scenes of The Doctors Daughter - Part 7
  

Excerpt from the Podcast Commentary from The Doctor’s Daughter, featuring...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of The Doctors Daughter - Part 7

Excerpt from the Podcast Commentary from The Doctor’s Daughter, featuring David Tennant, showrunner Russell T. Davies, and director Alice Troughton

AT: When you say she’s not his biological daughter you mean we’re not going to go back into his history…
RTD: We’re not going to meet Mrs. Who and say, “Here’s the kids”
AT:  Of course
RTD: It’s not “normal” family stuff
AT: Although that’s what people are thinking - “How are they going to do it?” - with the title being “The Doctor’s Daughter”
DT: I think that she’s more the Doctor’s actual daughter than a lot of people are expecting
RTD: Oh yes
DT: I think people are expecting she’ll be some android that the reconstituted Master has made out of ball bearings or something
RTD: [ laughs loudly ]
AT: Or the hand, I think, is the rumor at the moment
DT:  Oh is it?
RTD: Oh the Doctor’s hand becomes his daughter! With a manly hand!
[ much laughing ]

[ talking about how the progenation machine works ]
DT:  I suppose it must clone you to an extent because here’s Jenny with two hearts
RTD: Yes.  Possibly you could argue that that’s what you would look like as a woman
DT:  I should be so lucky
RTD:  You’d never go out
[ much prolonged laughter ]

Other parts of this set:  [One]  [Two]  [Three] [ Four ] [ Five ] [ Six ]

summary: It's so...interesting, I guess is the word? how vastly different our fandom's idea of "attractive" is from people even just...
body: It’s so…interesting, I guess is the word? how vastly different our fandom’s idea of “attractive” is from people even just outside the fandom. My mother, for instance, has read the book and plans to watch the series with me when it comes out. But when I showed her Desert Crowley (who most of the fandom thinks is gorgeous) yesterday, her response was, “What the hell is that???” which nearly ended me. I’m still laughing as we speak.

title: Doctor Who Impulse Buy Part 3
body:
As of right now, I have made it to disc 7 of the box set.  I made it to the half way mark.  Hooray!  Same as usual, I’m doing quick thoughts on each episode. 

The Parting of The Ways - I’m conflicted.  It was a great way for Eccleston’s departure as The Doctor to face the Daleks, however, the reasoning on how he ended up being forced to regenerate seems kind of confusing to understand.  He had to absorb an energy signature that the Tardis uses out of Rose after she pulls a deus ex machina that destroyed the Dalek fleet.  Um okay. 

The acting is top notch by everyone and I definitely felt the tension rise as more and more humans got killed.  Except for the character Jack since he ends up having a series of his own named Torchwood.  He did go out heroically, it’s just seems like having him revived feels quite random.  John Barrowman is a great actor, I just feel I could have more time spent with him interacting with Rose and The Doctor.

Great build-up of the conflict.  Too bad the resolution feels like contrivances that happened than The Doctor using his extensive knowledge to save the day.

The Christmas Invasion - Since The Doctor regenerated, he is out of commission for most of the episode.  For the most part, seeing Rose, Mickey, and Jackie figure out their situation without The Doctor makes them quite useless.  Rose does the most, just not enough to save the day other than keep The Doctor resting.  When Tennant does awaken, he seems to effortlessly save the day making the threat seem really dumb in retrospect.

The one character that did stand out was the actress playing Harriet Jones, the Prime Minister of Britain.  She was quite charismatic and level-headed throughout the whole situation.  Plus, she does something that makes her quite interesting at the end that makes her challenge The Doctor’s belief in her.  Slow at first but picks up when The Doctor finishes his nap.

I will also not find Christmas trees to be all that terrifying in the slightest.  That whole attacking spinning tree looked so stupid to me.

New Earth - A antagonist returns and she is still lame as ever.  Cassandra, a face stretched out somehow gains the ability to transfer her conscience into other peoples body.  Also there are cat people with stellar special effects on their faces and zombies, sort of.  People are being given all diseases at once and act like zombies for some reason.  Once they touch you, they immediate infect them.

A silly episode that has funny and genuine moments.  It also showcases how much effort the show puts in with practical effects.  The makeup for the cat people look stunning and makes me appreciate this series even more.

Tooth and Claw - Werewolves hunting Queen Victoria sounds good on paper, ends up being somewhat forgettable in retrospect.  The Doctor’s interactions with Queen Victoria are quite good, it’s just muddled with bland characters and an antagonist who I think I was supposed to feel sorry for.  (shrugs)

There were monks that took over the estate that I thought were going be more problematic as they did bring a werewolf to attack Queen Victoria. I’m just not sure where they disappeared to once the werewolf ended up defeated.  If this was addressed, I must have missed it. 

A bad CGI werewolf and that setting up the spin-off series Torchwood was all this episode was about.

School Reunion -  Really great episode, just not sure about a villain that eats children.  Don’t get me wrong, Anthony Head is phenomenal here, it’s just having his introduction kill a child seems in poor taste to me.

Here we are introduced to an old companion of The Doctor, Sarah Jane Smith who is quite familiar with his antics.  (And a robot dog for some reason. 
This show can be weird sometimes.)  Sarah and The Doctor have instant chemistry and seeing those two interacting is delightful.  We also see Mickey have a more involved role as he helps out however he can by being a hacker.  I wish he was more involved in the series and what I have seen of him so far, they did him good.

If you can get over the whole child being eaten moment, this is definitely one of the best episodes as Anthony Head and David Tennant act off each other quite well. Plus seeing someone who is familiar with The Doctor’s antics give advice to Rose is a nice moment.  I kind of wish Sarah Jane appeared more with the Tenth Doctor.  Just not the robot dog. It seems really dumb to look at.  Rush it is not.

Phew, only 9 more discs to go…

A silly episode that has funny and genuine moments.  It also showcases how much effort the show puts in with practical effects.  The makeup for the cat people look stunning and makes me appreciate this series even more.

Tooth and Claw - Werewolves hunting Queen Victoria sounds good on paper, ends up being somewhat forgettable in retrospect.  The Doctor’s interactions with Queen Victoria are quite good, it’s just muddled with bland characters and an antagonist who I think I was supposed to feel sorry for.  (shrugs)

There were monks that took over the estate that I thought were going be more problematic as they did bring a werewolf to attack Queen Victoria. I’m just not sure where they disappeared to once the werewolf ended up defeated.  If this was addressed, I must have missed it. 

A bad CGI werewolf and that setting up the spin-off series Torchwood was all this episode was about.

School Reunion -  Really great episode, just not sure about a villain that eats children.  Don’t get me wrong, Anthony Head is phenomenal here, it’s just having his introduction kill a child seems in poor taste to me.

Here we are introduced to an old companion of The Doctor, Sarah Jane Smith who is quite familiar with his antics.  (And a robot dog for some reason. 
This show can be weird sometimes.)  Sarah and The Doctor have instant chemistry and seeing those two interacting is delightful.  We also see Mickey have a more involved role as he helps out however he can by being a hacker.  I wish he was more involved in the series and what I have seen of him so far, they did him good.

If you can get over the whole child being eaten moment, this is definitely one of the best episodes as Anthony Head and David Tennant act off each other quite well. Plus seeing someone who is familiar with The Doctor’s antics give advice to Rose is a nice moment.  I kind of wish Sarah Jane appeared more with the Tenth Doctor.  Just not the robot dog. It seems really dumb to look at.  Rush it is not.

Phew, only 9 more discs to go…
